details.title: What is General Writing Task 1?
details.description: In Task 1 of General Writing you need to write a letter with at least 150 words in less than 20 minutes. Take a look at this video to get more information.

details.title: Who should write General Writing Task 1?
details.description: Anyone who is applying for migration or a permanent residencein Australia, Canada and New Zealand or anyone who has a work visa  can write Writing Task 1.

details.title: Common mistakes in letter writing
details.description: Writing a letter in one paragraph and writing memorised answers are some common mistakes seen in a letter. Such mistakes and how to avoid it will be discussed in this video.

details.title: What is the Task 1 GT format
details.description: Do you know how the various letters of the general training modules are structured? Know how they are structured in this video!

details.title: Types of Letter Writing
details.description: Anything from a formal to an informal letter is quite common on the IELTS GT writing test. Find out more about them in this video.

details.title: Formal Letter
details.description: Writing to a principal or perhaps someone of authority can be quite a troublesome task. Letâ€™s make it a little less of that. All and more in this video!

details.title: Informal Letter
details.description: The medium you use to get in touch with your long lost friend needs a bit of thought. Lets watch this video and know what are the thing to take into account when writing an informal letter.

details.title: Semi-formal letter
details.description: Need to get in touch with the accountant that looks after your numbers? Then a semi-formal letter should do the job. Find out more about this type of letter from this video.

details.title: Writing Task 1 Assessment Criteria
details.description: Examiners look for a lot of things when assessing your writing task 1 response of the general training module. This video will discuss the thing that you need to keep in mind when crafting your response.

details.title: Differences between Formal and Informal Letter
details.description: This video will pit a formal letter against an informal one and then compare various aspects in them.

details.title: Different ways to begin a letter
details.description: The biggening of a letter has to be picture-perfect in order to make a good first impression on the examiner. Watch on and find out what are the various ways you can start a letter.

details.title: Different ways to end a letter
details.description: Something has begun well is expedcted to end well. Do you know how to end you letter well? Have a look and find out for yourself.

details.title: Tenses to Use in Letter Writing
details.description: Do you write your letters in a single tense or a combination of tenses? To clear your ideas of tenses in letters, here is a video which explains just that.

details.title: Formal Letter Writing Solved with sample answer
details.description: In this video, a formal letter writing question will be solved along with the explanation of the answer.

details.title: Informal Letter Writing Solved with sample answer
details.description: In this video, an informal letter writing question will be solved along with the explanation of the answer.

details.title: Semi-formal Letter Writing Solved with sample answer
details.description: In this video, a semi-formal letter writing question will be solved along with the explanation of the answer.
